meanings.definition: Control every part, however small, of (an enterprise or activity)
meanings.sent1: She was micromanaging the project, making sure every little detail was perfect.
meanings.sent2: The boss tends to micromanage, always wanting to oversee every aspect of the work.
meanings.sent3: The team joked that the supervisor was micromanaging even the color of the post-it notes.
meanings.sent4: Her way of micromanaging the situation was like trying to control the wind with a net.
meanings.sent5: Micromanaging the event felt like trying to count every grain of sand on the beach.

meanings.definition: Manage with excessive control or attention to minor details.
meanings.sent1: He is always micromanaging his employees, never letting them make decisions on their own.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was criticized for micromanaging the students' group projects.
meanings.sent3: The chef's habit of micromanaging the kitchen led to some comical mix-ups.
meanings.sent4: Micromanaging the situation was like trying to paint a masterpiece with a toothpick.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't help but micromanage, even when it came to arranging her bookshelf.
